{"acronym":"oscal19","aspect_ratio":"16:9","updated_at":"2025-07-06T19:00:07.605+02:00","title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","schedule_url":"","slug":"conferences/oscal19","event_last_released_at":"2020-02-15T00:00:00.000+01:00","link":"","description":"","webgen_location":"conferences/oscal19","logo_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/oscal-19.png","images_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019","recordings_url":"https://cdn.media.ccc.de/events/oscal/2019","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","events":[{"guid":"0167434e-9ba2-5eb0-b146-13ace126eda9","title":"Magento 2 Introduction","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-21-magento_2_introduction","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"In this presentation, you will find information related to foundation of Magento 2, it's capabilities, modern technology stack, improved performance and scalability, as well as other useful features and enhancements. It will include some historical information about Magento and also a look at it foundation and evolution. Furthermore, will also be described the Magento web technologies and the most popular integration. We will try to make a realistic and statistical comparison between Magento 2 and other platforms. At the end of the presentation, I will focus more on the admin panel, explain the code structure and will show how custom modules/extensions are installed and configured.

In this presentation, you will find information related to foundation of Magento 2, it's capabilities, modern technology stack, improved performance and scalability, as well as other useful features and enhancements. It will include some historical information about Magento and also a look at it foundation and evolution. Furthermore, will also be described the Magento web technologies and the most popular integration. We will try to make a realistic and statistical comparison between Magento 2 and other platforms. At the end of the presentation, I will focus more on the admin panel, explain the code structure and will show how custom modules/extensions are installed and configured.","original_language":"eng","persons":["Daniel Bello"],"tags":["oscal2019","21","2019"],"view_count":23,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-19T15:10:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-12T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-01-09T11:15:05.459+01:00","length":1224,"duration":1224,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/21-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/21-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/21-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/21-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-21-magento_2_introduction","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/0167434e-9ba2-5eb0-b146-13ace126eda9","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"4f646b50-1cc1-5d68-be2d-2085f59a3e1a","title":"Presentation of the pilot-project and website 'Preservingtirana.city', the common public platform, connecting Participatory Architecture to Open Source culture.","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-18-presentation_of_the_pilot_project_and_website_preservingtirana_city_the_common_public_platform_connecting_participatory_architecture_to_open_source_culture","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"The initial idea of our project started after a dedicated research project developed on the urban texture of the city of Tirana where many issues of the urban development were identified. This lead to the grassroots development of Preservingtirana.city as a necessary, interactive platform for the online documentation of some important assets of Tirana's Identity as a city, the 'neglected buildings'with a specific historical, cultural and architectural value left in the deterioration of the course of nature. An innovative added value of the project is the fact that the website has been created in all of its phases through the notions of an Open source platform, all the data and content of the website can be found on GitHub so that it can be a public common project offering the opportunity to the community and people interested to contribute to its further development, in different ways (detaily explained how, on the website). Apart from using GitHub as an open source platform for the community engagement, we use also Wikimedia Commons for all the visual contents (images) of the website as a further step that enriches the project and offers another way of contributing at the same time to two different platforms. One of the ways of contributing can be done also through Cryptocurrency, since a bitcoin-wallet was provided specifically for the website Preservingtirana.city. The project aims to raise the awareness of people to participate in preserving their common public assets of the city they live in, aims to give to people interested, the basic notions of using GitHub or Wikimedia commons and it also represents a pilot-project that starts with Tirana but that can be implemented for several other cities that suffer from the same problematics, once the structure already exists. A first presentation of the website happened on the beginning of January, at Open Labs Hackerpace Ti rana, a very supportive community for the project. To see all the above mentioned issues please check the website: www.preservingtirana.city

The initial idea of our project started after a dedicated research project developed on the urban texture of the city of Tirana where many issues of the urban development were identified. This lead to the grassroots development of Preservingtirana.city as a necessary, interactive platform for the online documentation of some important assets of Tirana's Identity as a city, the 'neglected buildings' with a specific historical, cultural and architectural value left in the deterioration of the course of nature. An innovative added value of the project is the fact that the website has been created in all of its phases through the notions of an Open source platform, all the data and content of the website can be found on GitHub so that it can be a public common project offering the opportunity to the community and people interested to contribute to its further development, in different ways (detaily explained how, on the website). Apart from using GitHub as an open source platform for the community engagement, we use also Wikimedia Commons for all the visual contents (images) of the website as a further step that enriches the project and offers another way of contributing at the same time to two different platforms. One of the ways of contributing can be done also through Cryptocurrency, since a bitcoin-wallet was provided specifically for the website Preservingtirana.city. The project aims to raise the awareness of people to participate in preserving their common public assets of the city they live in, aims to give to people interested, the basic notions of using GitHub or Wikimedia commons and it also represents a pilot-project that starts with Tirana but that can be implemented for several other cities that suffer from the same problematics, once the structure already exists. A first presentation of the website happened on the beginning of January, at Open Labs Hackerpace Tirana, a very supportive community for the project. To see all the above mentioned issues please check the website: www.preservingtirana.city","original_language":"eng","persons":["Jora Kasapi"],"tags":["oscal2019","18","2019"],"view_count":38,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-19T12:25:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-15T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2024-09-28T10:00:02.214+02:00","length":1483,"duration":1483,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/18-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/18-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/18-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/18-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-18-presentation_of_the_pilot_project_and_website_preservingtirana_city_the_common_public_platform_connecting_participatory_architecture_to_open_source_culture","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/4f646b50-1cc1-5d68-be2d-2085f59a3e1a","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"50b72163-960d-545c-9f7e-46f721798625","title":"Public Money? Public Code!","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-3-public_money_public_code","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"Why is software that is programmed with taxpayers' money not released as Free Software? We want legislation requiring that publicly financed software developed for public sector must be made publicly available under a Free and Open Source Software licence. If it is public money, it should be public code as well. Code paid by all people should be available to all people! This talk will provide a brief overview of the FSFE's previous and ongoing activities to foster software freedom in Europe on the levels of politics, legal work with enterprises, and general public awareness.

Why is software that is programmed with taxpayers' money not released as Free Software? We want legislation requiring that publicly financed software developed for public sector must be made publicly available under a Free and Open Source Software licence. If it is public money, it should be public code as well. Code paid by all people should be available to all people! This talk will provide a brief overview of the FSFE's previous and ongoing activities to foster software freedom in Europe on the levels of politics, legal work with enterprises, and general public awareness.","original_language":"eng","persons":["Alexander Sander"],"tags":["oscal2019","3","2019"],"view_count":135,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T10:05:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-15T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-06-15T21:00:05.461+02:00","length":1843,"duration":1843,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/3-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/3-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/3-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/3-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-3-public_money_public_code","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/50b72163-960d-545c-9f7e-46f721798625","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"f2d6cd35-3acb-5f76-a07b-b92566e6b3b5","title":"Shoot all the hackers","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-2-shoot_all_the_hackers","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":""Shoot ALL the Hackers!": one of the long-running photography projects by Dennis van Zuijlekom (Hackerspace Hack42, Arnhem). Its focus is portrait photography of persons who relate themselves to hacker/maker culture. Dennis started this project in 2015 and it'll never be truly finished, as there will always be new hackers to photograph, as well as old friends having new faces. Dennis takes great pride in photographing people looking at their very best and the results speak for themselves. He'll invite you to have your headshot taken during this event (and/or sometime afterwards). You'll be using his photo in your personal bio, guaranteed. The project and the photos are licensed Creative Commons, CC-BY-SA, as Open Source and free/libre content is important to Dennis.

"Shoot ALL the Hackers!": one of the long-running photography projects by Dennis van Zuijlekom (Hackerspace Hack42, Arnhem). Its focus is portrait photography of persons who relate themselves to hacker/maker culture. Dennis started this project in 2015 and it'll never be truly finished, as there will always be new hackers to photograph, as well as old friends having new faces. Dennis takes great pride in photographing people looking at their very best and the results speak for themselves. He'll invite you to have your headshot taken during this event (and/or sometime afterwards). You'll be using his photo in your personal bio, guaranteed. The project and the photos are licensed Creative Commons, CC-BY-SA, as Open Source and free/libre content is important to Dennis.","original_language":"eng","persons":["Dennis van Zuijlekom "],"tags":["oscal2019","2","2019"],"view_count":116,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T09:50:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-11T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-06-25T12:15:06.058+02:00","length":512,"duration":512,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/2-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/2-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/2-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/2-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-2-shoot_all_the_hackers","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/f2d6cd35-3acb-5f76-a07b-b92566e6b3b5","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"359a105f-5f9c-5d52-9f05-c14722786cc7","title":"Open Source Product Development: from research to release","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-5-open_source_product_development_from_research_to_release","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"In 1974 Fred Brooks argued that an app requires nine times extra work to take it from merely being functional, to being a usable product. This challenge is as real now as it was then. What is this extra work, and can you do it using pure Open Source?

In 1974 Fred Brooks argued that an app requires nine times extra work to take it from merely being functional, to being a usable product. This challenge is as real now as it was then. What is this extra work, and can you do it using pure Open Source?","original_language":"eng","persons":["Sam Tuke"],"tags":["oscal2019","5","2019"],"view_count":23,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T11:15:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-11T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-03-16T18:15:06.554+01:00","length":2028,"duration":2028,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/5-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/5-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/5-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/5-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-5-open_source_product_development_from_research_to_release","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/359a105f-5f9c-5d52-9f05-c14722786cc7","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"9b4539af-7ac4-592a-a168-1f98358b1a1b","title":"Unexpectedly Agile","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-14-unexpectedly_agile","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"I will cover basics of Agile processes along with these sub-topics:  - Agile documentation  - Open source project management tools for agile teams

I will cover basics of Agile processes along with these sub-topics: - Agile documentation - Open source project management tools for agile teams","original_language":"eng","persons":["Amita Sharma"],"tags":["oscal2019","14","2019"],"view_count":28,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-19T10:25:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-12T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2022-11-07T22:30:11.028+01:00","length":2517,"duration":2517,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/14-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/14-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/14-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/14-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-14-unexpectedly_agile","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/9b4539af-7ac4-592a-a168-1f98358b1a1b","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"5e2d97b2-b528-52df-a545-726de4683764","title":"Introduction to Anonymous Mix Networks","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-11-introduction_to_anonymous_mix_networks","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"I shall explain the renewed interest in mix networks. Like Tor, mix networks protect against metadata leakage by using layered encryption and routing packets between a series of independent nodes. Mix networks resist vastly more powerful adversary models than Tor though, including global passive adversaries. In so doing, mix networks add both latency and cover traffic. We shall outline the basic components of a mix network, touch on their roles in resisting active and passive attacks, and discuss how the latency impacts reliability, application design, and user experience.

I shall explain the renewed interest in mix networks. Like Tor, mix networks protect against metadata leakage by using layered encryption and routing packets between a series of independent nodes. Mix networks resist vastly more powerful adversary models than Tor though, including global passive adversaries. In so doing, mix networks add both latency and cover traffic. We shall outline the basic components of a mix network, touch on their roles in resisting active and passive attacks, and discuss how the latency impacts reliability, application design, and user experience.","original_language":"eng","persons":["David Stainton"],"tags":["oscal2019","11","2019"],"view_count":60,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T16:05:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-11T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-03-25T08:30:05.737+01:00","length":1360,"duration":1360,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/11-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/11-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/11-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/11-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-11-introduction_to_anonymous_mix_networks","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/5e2d97b2-b528-52df-a545-726de4683764","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"5c15b5b1-b81c-57ab-a708-a2f2c27d8543","title":"Why Are You So Busy?","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-19-why_are_you_so_busy","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"For this presentation we look at a simple but very fundamental question: why are you so busy? Are you wondering what happened in the last 30 years which caused such a shift in the amount of work we do on a daily basis? And how you can improve your coping skills so you can spend more time on the things that really matter? If so, this presentation is for you! We'll dive deeper into how we got here, and -more importantly- how we can make everything a little better for ourselves.

For this presentation we look at a simple but very fundamental question: why are you so busy? Are you wondering what happened in the last 30 years which caused such a shift in the amount of work we do on a daily basis? And how you can improve your coping skills so you can spend more time on the things that really matter? If so, this presentation is for you! We'll dive deeper into how we got here, and -more importantly- how we can make everything a little better for ourselves.","original_language":"eng","persons":["Ritger Teunissen"],"tags":["oscal2019","19","2019"],"view_count":87,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-19T14:00:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-12T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2024-06-12T09:45:03.216+02:00","length":1367,"duration":1367,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/19-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/19-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/19-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/19-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-19-why_are_you_so_busy","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/5c15b5b1-b81c-57ab-a708-a2f2c27d8543","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"20a5647b-f9ba-5a83-a3b6-a923e17571b4","title":"The New Media, ethics and online (self)censorship","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-20-the_new_media_ethics_and_online_self_censorship","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"The new draft law about the online media presents a huge risk for (self)censorship. On the other hand the New Media have created an un-ethical chaos in the field of news and reporting. Can it ever be fixed?

The new draft law about the online media presents a huge risk for (self)censorship. On the other hand the New Media have created an un-ethical chaos in the field of news and reporting. Can it ever be fixed?","original_language":"eng","persons":["Koloreto Cukali"],"tags":["oscal2019","20","2019"],"view_count":38,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-19T14:35:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-15T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2024-10-08T20:15:02.469+02:00","length":1615,"duration":1615,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/20-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/20-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/20-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/20-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-20-the_new_media_ethics_and_online_self_censorship","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/20a5647b-f9ba-5a83-a3b6-a923e17571b4","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"6a7083dd-e1e7-59ad-a346-ca995cfba637","title":"Opening Speech","subtitle":"","slug":"oscal19-1-opening_speech","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"Opening Speech
","original_language":"eng","persons":["Nafie Shehu","Redon Skikuli"],"tags":["oscal2019","1","2019"],"view_count":27,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T09:30:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-11T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-05-09T20:00:02.591+02:00","length":1239,"duration":1239,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/1-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/1-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/1-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/1-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-1-opening_speech","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/6a7083dd-e1e7-59ad-a346-ca995cfba637","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"2934b9ea-bba0-5516-9d66-3268a3f4b96e","title":"How OpenStreetMap became the best map of Kosovo","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-16-how_openstreetmap_became_the_best_map_of_kosovo","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"Even more than elsewhere, the best map of Kosovo can only come from local mappers - big proprietary map makers can't and don't care to keep up. This is how the Kosovo community managed to get official data opened, how we integrated that data into the map, and how people in Kosovo are using the map.

Even more than elsewhere, the best map of Kosovo can only come from local mappers - big proprietary map makers can't and don't care to keep up. This is how the Kosovo community managed to get official data opened, how we integrated that data into the map, and how people in Kosovo are using the map.","original_language":"eng","persons":["Guillaume Rischard","Besfort Guri"],"tags":["oscal2019","16","2019"],"view_count":126,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-19T11:15:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-12T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-07-06T19:00:07.602+02:00","length":1071,"duration":1071,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/16-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/16-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/16-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/16-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-16-how_openstreetmap_became_the_best_map_of_kosovo","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/2934b9ea-bba0-5516-9d66-3268a3f4b96e","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"3fa96d0d-cf91-515c-b248-c8fc518f5dfa","title":"Slideshow karaoke","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-22-slideshow_karaoke","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"Slideshow karaoke

Slideshow karaoke","original_language":"eng","persons":["Adam Samalik"],"tags":["oscal2019","22","2019"],"view_count":55,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-19T15:40:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-13T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2024-08-28T17:00:03.659+02:00","length":1186,"duration":1186,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/22-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/22-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/22-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/22-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-22-slideshow_karaoke","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/3fa96d0d-cf91-515c-b248-c8fc518f5dfa","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"a8a55a35-1ded-590c-a0c9-81bbca3f1984","title":"How to contribute to Open Source without coding?","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-15-how_to_contribute_to_open_source_without_coding","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"Some tips for non programmers or beginners to contribute to Open Source.

Some tips for non programmers or beginners to contribute to Open Source.","original_language":"eng","persons":["Eduart Milushi"],"tags":["oscal2019","15","2019"],"view_count":35,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-19T11:00:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-12T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2024-09-27T15:15:05.200+02:00","length":975,"duration":975,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/15-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/15-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/15-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/15-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-15-how_to_contribute_to_open_source_without_coding","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/a8a55a35-1ded-590c-a0c9-81bbca3f1984","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"c4bee4b7-9d46-5adf-bb80-94bc7b425bca","title":"Open Source Business Models","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-6-open_source_business_models","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"Giving your software away for free is a terrible way to make money. But entrepreneurs should still consider open sourcing their software--many successful companies have done so! But how? The goal of the podcast "Open Source Underdogs" was to interview the most prominent founders in the industry to shed light on their stories. Although each business is different, some common themes emerge. In this talk, Mike will talk about what he's learned after the last 22 interviews. The goal is to both inspire and challenge entreneurs to consider open source software developement's strengths and weaknesses as part of a business model.
Information on this topic will be gathered from descriptive data of the social networks,from media and from direct answers on how much time people (students, random workers) spend.
        

Giving your software away for free is a terrible way to make money. But entrepreneurs should still consider open sourcing their software--many successful companies have done so! But how? The goal of the podcast "Open Source Underdogs" was to interview the most prominent founders in the industry to shed light on their stories. Although each business is different, some common themes emerge. In this talk, Mike will talk about what he's learned after the last 22 interviews. The goal is to both inspire and challenge entreneurs to consider open source software developement's strengths and weaknesses as part of a business model.
Information on this topic will be gathered from descriptive data of the social networks,from media and from direct answers on how much time people (students, random workers) spend.

Introduction to the model of organization structure in Wikipedia and other Wikimedia projects, especially Wikimedia Commons: how to categorize articles in Wikipedia and Commons.","original_language":"eng","persons":["Lars Haefner"],"tags":["oscal2019","17","2019"],"view_count":26,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-19T11:50:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-12T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-06-07T15:30:04.670+02:00","length":1209,"duration":1209,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/17-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/17-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/17-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/17-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-17-categorizing_wikipedia","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/d641a610-03ae-5e97-b919-c35b28306ed7","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"065e09fd-df35-5887-a1d6-5cf2b9bd5a95","title":"Linux distributions, lifecycles, and containers","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-7-linux_distributions_lifecycles_and_containers","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"Deploying software has lots of solutions, but what gets deployed often plays out as a fight between developers and operators. Developers want the latest (or at least later) code. Operators want things in nice packages, certified, and with a known period of support. What we need is a catalog of software with the variety of versions the developers need, with the qualities expected by the operators. Come and learn how various projects within Fedora approach this problem from different perspectives, including Fedora Modularity, containers, Fedora CoreOS, and Fedora Silverblue.

Deploying software has lots of solutions, but what gets deployed often plays out as a fight between developers and operators. Developers want the latest (or at least later) code. Operators want things in nice packages, certified, and with a known period of support. What we need is a catalog of software with the variety of versions the developers need, with the qualities expected by the operators. Come and learn how various projects within Fedora approach this problem from different perspectives, including Fedora Modularity, containers, Fedora CoreOS, and Fedora Silverblue.","original_language":"eng","persons":["Adam Samalik"],"tags":["oscal2019","7","2019"],"view_count":63,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T12:25:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-11T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-05-21T12:15:05.290+02:00","length":1503,"duration":1503,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/7-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/7-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/7-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/7-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-7-linux_distributions_lifecycles_and_containers","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/065e09fd-df35-5887-a1d6-5cf2b9bd5a95","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"b90d39f8-5d69-58f0-aa4e-2592e16cb069","title":"post-its, post-its, post-its everywhere (and how they relate to physical keys)","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-9-post_its_post_its_post_its_everywhere_and_how_they_relate_to_physical_keys","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"A password shouldn't be on a post-it note.
In plain view.
On the console.
The password to a locked door is called a key.
So if a reporter wants to get the point across that certain people shouldn't have access to a particular key, would it be wise for said reporter to show that key to the world?
This talk will show how not to run this story, why we should care and maybe make you rethink your physical security a bit.
        

A password shouldn't be on a post-it note.
In plain view.
On the console.
The password to a locked door is called a key.
So if a reporter wants to get the point across that certain people shouldn't have access to a particular key, would it be wise for said reporter to show that key to the world?
This talk will show how not to run this story, why we should care and maybe make you rethink your physical security a bit.
        ","original_language":"eng","persons":["Jos Weyers"],"tags":["oscal2019","9","2019"],"view_count":107,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T14:35:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-11T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2024-09-28T04:00:02.660+02:00","length":2726,"duration":2726,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/9-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/9-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/9-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/9-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-9-post_its_post_its_post_its_everywhere_and_how_they_relate_to_physical_keys","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/b90d39f8-5d69-58f0-aa4e-2592e16cb069","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"ebeaa19d-0f2d-5587-ba8a-a94175792907","title":"The hairy issue of end to end encrypted instant messaging","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-12-the_hairy_issue_of_end_to_end_encrypted_instant_messaging","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"In XMPP there is a over 14 years of experience with end to end encryption in distributed chat systems. After 4 standards for e2e encryption, we are still not content. So what makes it so hard to come up with a good encryption standard? Well, to name some of the issues: - what is the threat model e2e encryption should protect against? - what about the metadata? - what about audit trails? - what about archives? - what about group chats? - what about multiple devices? - what about key-verification? After this talk you will never look at e2e encrypted chats in the same way again.

In XMPP there is a over 14 years of experience with end to end encryption in distributed chat systems. After 4 standards for e2e encryption, we are still not content. So what makes it so hard to come up with a good encryption standard? Well, to name some of the issues: - what is the threat model e2e encryption should protect against? - what about the metadata? - what about audit trails? - what about archives? - what about group chats? - what about multiple devices? - what about key-verification? After this talk you will never look at e2e encrypted chats in the same way again.","original_language":"eng","persons":["Winfried Tilanus"],"tags":["oscal2019","12","2019"],"view_count":111,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T16:40:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-11T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2025-03-04T14:30:06.701+01:00","length":2110,"duration":2110,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/12-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/12-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/12-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/12-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-12-the_hairy_issue_of_end_to_end_encrypted_instant_messaging","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/ebeaa19d-0f2d-5587-ba8a-a94175792907","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"50b1fe0f-9beb-544a-b2f0-daf7b967bf45","title":"Presenting DOKU.TECH","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-13-presenting_doku_tech","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"Presenting DOKU.TECH

Presenting DOKU.TECH","original_language":"eng","persons":["Abetare Gojani"],"tags":["oscal2019","13","2019"],"view_count":23,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T17:15:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-11T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2024-04-18T14:00:05.622+02:00","length":609,"duration":609,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/13-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/13-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/13-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/13-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-13-presenting_doku_tech","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/50b1fe0f-9beb-544a-b2f0-daf7b967bf45","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"712260ed-4517-521d-a45e-cd0ce1a78263","title":"TFW your country is funding Open Source development","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-4-tfw_your_country_is_funding_open_source_development","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"During 2018 I've been a contractor for the Italian Digital Transformation Team working on docs.italia.it (Docs Italia), a platform to collect and share the Public Administration documentation. Docs Italia is an Open Source platform based on the Read The Docs code. Working in the open posed its own set of issues:

- does contributing upstream deliver value to our project?
- working productively with an Open Source community
- managing an Open Source project fork

In this talk I'll share what we did and how it did go.
        

During 2018 I've been a contractor for the Italian Digital Transformation Team working on docs.italia.it (Docs Italia), a platform to collect and share the Public Administration documentation. Docs Italia is an Open Source platform based on the Read The Docs code. Working in the open posed its own set of issues:

- does contributing upstream deliver value to our project?
- working productively with an Open Source community
- managing an Open Source project fork

In this talk I'll share what we did and how it did go.
        ","original_language":"eng","persons":["Riccardo Maggliocchetti"],"tags":["oscal2019","4","2019"],"view_count":21,"promoted":false,"date":"2019-05-18T10:40:00.000+02:00","release_date":"2020-02-11T00:00:00.000+01:00","updated_at":"2022-02-28T01:15:07.631+01:00","length":992,"duration":992,"thumb_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/4-hd.jpg","poster_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/4-hd_preview.jpg","timeline_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/4-hd.timeline.jpg","thumbnails_url":"https://static.media.ccc.de/media/events/oscal/2019/4-hd.thumbnails.vtt","frontend_link":"https://media.ccc.de/v/oscal19-4-tfw_your_country_is_funding_open_source_development","url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/events/712260ed-4517-521d-a45e-cd0ce1a78263","conference_title":"Open Source Conference Albania 2019","conference_url":"https://api.media.ccc.de/public/conferences/oscal19","related":[]},{"guid":"5df8a407-f0d2-5146-b99b-c49d9b9a2a15","title":"Technology of repression: then and now","subtitle":null,"slug":"oscal19-8-technology_of_repression_then_and_now","link":"https://c3voc.de","description":"Communist Albania has a reputation for tight surveillance of its population; how much more are we watched now?
